lexUnit.name: scarf.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: pl. scarves or scarfs a length or square of fabric worn around the neck or head.

sentence.text: The same people who backed Mr Rafsanjani 's economic reforms were soon complaining when a strand of hair appeared under a woman 's scarf .
Then she felt something on her arm and discovered her scarf had come undone .
` Do come to my picnic , " the woman said , and her voice sounded as her silk scarf sounds when it trails behind her through the branches in the wood .

` Do come to my picnic , " the woman said , and her voice sounded as her silk scarf sounds when it trails behind her through the branches in the wood .
He had on a beautiful dark double-breasted overcoat which he wore undone and draped round his shoulders was a tasselled white silk scarf .
He was wearing a thin jacket , tom in places , and a thick multi-coloured scarf .
big leaves for eyebrows and he 's got a lovely green and orange scarf , stripy scarf .
The Doctor hooked the handle of his umbrella over his top pocket and pulled his paisley scarf from around his neck .
` There 's got ta be thousands upon thousands here today , " Nancy remarked , pulling her scarf around her throat to keep out the cold .
The first day of term in the Foley household meant that Jack would put on a college scarf and head into UCD for the first time .
He puts a scarf around his head to try to sleep .
Isobel Thompson took off her scarf and ruffled her grey curls .
Maxim took off his silk scarf , wiped his brow and put the scarf in his pocket .
She untied the shoelace and did what she could to tame the unruly curls , then took off her red scarf and used it to tie her hair back firmly at the nape of her neck .

When you go to school you will wear a scarf over your hair and you will be taken there every morning by your husband . "
He was wearing a coat and a thick woollen scarf , to which he later claimed he owed his life .
This morning he was wearing a rugby scarf flung boyishly about his neck .
Constance had thick , coarse black hair and wore an orange scarf somehow knitted into it .
Anita wears a Tibetan scarf and high grey leg-warmers , her hair a tumble of untamed curls .
In the hall she wraps a long scarf round her neck and puts on a cream-coloured quilted cotton jacket , with wide shoulders and inset sleeves , and lets herself out by the front door .
As she reached for his other wrist and wrapped a red silk scarf around it , he said in a resigned voice , ` Are n't you going to undress me first ? "
A lady with a drained face wrapped in a nylon scarf and sitting at a table near by glanced up with a scowl .
Dressed in a summer frock patterned all over with scarlet poppies , a scarlet silk scarf wound round her head , she looked devastatingly pretty .
She wound a lime chiffon scarf of Madeleine 's around her head , and practised pouting with one hip thrust forward .
She tucked her dark blue silk scarf more securely into the neck of the beige jumper she wore under her thick tweed jacket .
The girl departed and Ella unwound the long woollen scarf from her thick neck , undid her coat and sighed with relief .
To counteract the effect of Lucenzo 's sensuality , she tucked her woolly scarf more firmly around her neck then dragged her pom-pom hat further over her reddening ears .
In the wheelchair was a woman , wearing a deep-crowned , wide-brimmed green felt hat , obscuring her face , and a paisley silk scarf at the throat of a caped loden coat .
She reached for her jacket , knotted the gay red scarf at her throat and tapped at Luke 's door , then went in .
The gambling king stood to one side , wrapped in a black kimono , a white scarf knotted at his throat .
She wore men 's trousers under a wrap-around overall , heavy clogs on her feet and a scarf tied round her head like a turban to keep her hair in place .
